snippet.textDisplay: It seems pretty clear that you haven't played enough of the game to know what you're talking about. Which is surprising considering you said 150hrs testing the game (maybe a lie?). Some of your 5 point perks are actually 1 point max, calming stroll is worthless, and so are several of your other recommendations. This isn't opinion. Several perks you suggested don't actually do anything or don't work the way you are thinking.

snippet.textDisplay:
Not going to lie, your playstyle is only a fraction of most players. You playstyle may may work for these perks but for the people who want to loot/avoid fights with raiders, then it is not ideal.

Night raid security lockers are busted. Field crafting skill works perfectly for free kit runs where you aren't prepared for everything and need to think on the go and make decisions according to loot found. Also proficient prier and gentle pressure make for a great combo for solo runs where you need resournces.

Your skill selection are catered to streamer pvp vibes
snippet.textOriginal:

snippet.textDisplay: A big misleading mistake here that tons of players are making, calming stroll DOES NOT regen stamina when you are doing your default jog, it ONLY works when you press V (or whatever your slow walk keybind/button is) - This makes it really really bad in my opinion, careful you might brick some people's builds with that thing.
snippet.textOriginal: A big misleading mistake here that tons of players are making, calming stroll DOES NOT regen stamina when you are doing your default jog, it ONLY works when you press V (or whatever your slow walk keybind/button is) - This makes it really really bad in my opinion, careful you might brick some people's builds with that thing.

snippet.textDisplay:
I think the mobility perk "Calming Stroll" (by itself) might be a trap if you're not looking to go deeper into that part of the mobility tree, and here's why:
"Not sprinting" does not equal walking because, In ARC Raiders, there's a dedicated button (I think V by default on PC) that makes the character walk at a reduced pace.
snippet.textOriginal:
I think the mobility perk "Calming Stroll" (by itself) might be a trap if you're not looking to go deeper into that part of the mobility tree, and here's why:
"Not sprinting" does not equal walking because, In ARC Raiders, there's a dedicated button (I think V by default on PC) that makes the character walk at a reduced pace.

snippet.textDisplay: If they didn't change it, Calming Stroll is for walking, not jogging or sprinting. Meaning that you need to have a button to walk slowly (some people call it lore-walking, aura-walking playfully) or I guess while aiming could be considered walking. I that regard I actually don't know how useful it could actually be. As it says it doesn't increase your stamina regeneration, but just makes it the same as standing still. I think for the regeneration part maybe it's gonna be better to go with survival (crouch regen and healing regen) and conditioning (fixed stamina regen when hit and regen when low hp)
snippet.textOriginal: If they didn't change it, Calming Stroll is for walking, not jogging or sprinting. Meaning that you need to have a button to walk slowly (some people call it lore-walking, aura-walking playfully) or I guess while aiming could be considered walking. I that regard I actually don't know how useful it could actually be. As it says it doesn't increase your stamina regeneration, but just makes it the same as standing still. I think for the regeneration part maybe it's gonna be better to go with survival (crouch regen and healing regen) and conditioning (fixed stamina regen when hit and regen when low hp)

snippet.textDisplay: Nice build Livid! I feel like 90% of the skill builds I've been seeing have been nearly maxing out the survival tree just for Security Breach, which I think is stupid. This build feels super balanced.
snippet.textOriginal: Nice build Livid! I feel like 90% of the skill builds I've been seeing have been nearly maxing out the survival tree just for Security Breach, which I think is stupid. This build feels super balanced.

snippet.textDisplay: just wanna share that y'all channel, videos, community is amazing, and you all set the bar for what a gaming community and channel should be. Im so wanting to love Arc and play it, but Im admittedly just not a hardcore pvper. I refunded the game after the slam because I just wasnt having fun, getting camp killed a lot at the extraction zones....and everything seemed to devolve into PVP all the time - at the expense of the beautiful world, the ARCs themselves etc. and through your videos my excitement and desire to like this game has returned. seriously I hope Embark is paying you all because the marketing you do FOR them is more valuable than anything they do on their own. You guys are really good. that said, Ive bought the game again because I really want to enjoy it. Here's to hoping a few things happen. I can grow as a player and appreciate aspects I havent before, and they add in more reasons to work together and more social systems for groups.
snippet.textOriginal: just wanna share that y'all channel, videos, community is amazing, and you all set the bar for what a gaming community and channel should be. Im so wanting to love Arc and play it, but Im admittedly just not a hardcore pvper. I refunded the game after the slam because I just wasnt having fun, getting camp killed a lot at the extraction zones....and everything seemed to devolve into PVP all the time - at the expense of the beautiful world, the ARCs themselves etc. and through your videos my excitement and desire to like this game has returned. seriously I hope Embark is paying you all because the marketing you do FOR them is more valuable than anything they do on their own. You guys are really good. that said, Ive bought the game again because I really want to enjoy it. Here's to hoping a few things happen. I can grow as a player and appreciate aspects I havent before, and they add in more reasons to work together and more social systems for groups.
